text.text:
I had an excellent stay at Taz Kamar Inn in Chennai. The hotel is located in the heart of T. Nagar, making it very convenient for shopping and getting around the city. Despite the busy area, the hotel itself is calm, clean, and well-maintained.

The room was spacious, neat, and equipped with everything needed for a comfortable stay. The facilities are modern and well-kept, and I truly appreciated the attention to cleanliness throughout the property.

What really made the experience special was the hospitality of the staff. Everyone was very kind, respectful, and attentive. A special thanks to Mr. Abdul Rauf, who went out of his way to make sure all our needs were taken care of. His helpful attitude, professionalism, and warm nature truly stood out and made our stay even more memorable.

Overall, I highly recommend Taz Kamar Inn to anyone visiting Chennai. Whether you’re here for shopping, business, or family visits, this hotel offers great comfort, value, and excellent service.

text.text: Our group stayed at room 202, 205 & 207. The standard of the rooms were atrocious. The towels were very dirty, had numerous stains and was brownish instead of white due to old age. The soap dispenser was faulty and the replacement never came even after requesting. The room service personnel were requested to clean and replace the towels and water bottles. However, they constantly did not replace these items. Furthermore, the Front Office Manager Mr Riyas was extremely rude and impolite when Ms Mahalechumi spoke with him over the phone. On the final day we checked out at 6am and when we requested for a discount since we were checking out almost half a day before the usual check out time and weren’t even taking breakfast, they denied a discount although the previous day we were told that there would be a discount. We are very disappointed with the quality of service and standard.

text.text:
1. We asked for cold water to be brought to our room. No one showed up. So we called the reception 4 times. Every time someone said that they’ve informed the staff and some is bringing it up right now. No one showed up for 30 minutes. 30 minutes later, we get a call and are told that there is no cold water. This could’ve been done initially. But we simply asked for an ice bucket. No one showed up again. Then a staff showed but with regular bottle. We asked him to bring an ice bucket. We were in a hurry. We had to head out: we only delayed our departure because we were waiting for cold water. But we couldn’t delay it anymore. Then the staff assured me that he will bring the ice bucket immediately because I made him aware of the urgency. No one showed up yet again for another 10 minutes. So now we headed out. All we wanted was a bottle of cold water on a hot day because we didn’t have a bottle of water in the fridge in our room.
2. The creamer and coffee was not replenished when the room was cleaned.

All in all the service was poor. For the price that you seek, it’s not worth it at all. I wouldn’t book my stay here again

text.text: I recently had the pleasure of staying at Pullman Chennai, and I must say, it was a truly lovely experience. The hotel's culinary offerings were exceptional, and the hospitality was outstanding. The buffet service was well-organized, and the staff demonstrated a high level of professionalism. I would particularly like to commend Suraj Singh, whose exceptional guest profiling skills and proactive approach significantly enhanced my stay. His ability to anticipate and meet guests' needs was impressive. Overall, I was thoroughly satisfied with my stay and would highly recommend Pullman Chennai to others. Thank you to the entire team for a wonderful experience.

editorialSummary.text: Contemporary hotel offering a rooftop restaurant & a 24-hour cafe, plus an outdoor pool & a spa.

text.text:
I had the pleasure of visiting The Pride Hotel, Chennai yesterday, and I must say the experience was absolutely phenomenal! From the moment we stepped in, the hospitality was top-notch & every member of the staff made us feel incredibly welcome.

A special shout out to the Food and Beverage team their service was nothing short of outstanding. They were attentive, friendly & went above and beyond to ensure we had a memorable dining experience.

We were lucky to catch the final day of a truly amazing food festival. The variety, flavors, and presentation of the dishes were simply outstanding! It’s unfortunate that it was the last day, because I would’ve loved to return for more.

The hotel features both a rooftop restaurant with a beautiful ambiance and a stylish ground floor restaurant, both serving delicious food & offering fantastic service. Whether you’re a guest at the hotel or just stopping by for a meal, I highly recommend dining at either location.

Kudos to the entire team at The Pride Hotel for creating such a wonderful atmosphere and delivering excellence at every level. We’ll definitely be back!

text.text:
We are from TCL - TATA Communications Ltd, Chennai. We recently (25-07-2025) hosted a Cocktail Party in Pavilion Hall at Hotel Pride Chennai, and the entire experience was exceptional from start to finish!

The venue was beautifully maintained, clean, and perfectly arranged. From the welcome drink and starters to the main course, every item on the menu was absolutely delicious—our guests were truly impressed. The bar counter setup was elegant and well-organized, adding a classy touch to the event.

A special mention to the F&B Manager Mr.Jyothi Sankar & team for serving everything with such warmth and a smile—their hospitality really stood out and created a wonderful atmosphere.

Heartfelt thanks to the F&B Manager and the Master Chef Mr.Ganesh & Mr.Sudeep for the excellent planning, execution, and flavors. Also, sincere appreciation to the Front Office Manager Mr.Alex and team for warmly receiving guests and guiding them smoothly to the event space.

Thanks as well to the Security team for efficiently managing the parking area, and to the Housekeeping manager Mr.Sridhar & team for keeping the venue spotless throughout.

Highly recommend Hotel Pride, Chennai for any Corporate Cocktail Party/Event—professional service, top-quality food, and a team that truly cares about delivering a great experience.

I had a wonderful experience staying at Pride Hotel in Chennai. From the moment I checked in, the staff was courteous, welcoming, and helpful. The room was clean, well maintained, and offered all the modern amenities I needed for a comfortable stay.

The location is very convenient close to the metro and key parts of the city. I especially appreciated the breakfast buffet, which had a wide variety of delicious South Indian and continental options.

But the service throughout was  average Whether it was housekeeping, front desk, or room service, everyone was a little  less attentive
Overall, I had a relaxing and pleasant stay. I would definitely recommend Pride Hotel to anyone visiting Chennai, whether for business or leisure

text.text:
Elegant Property, Excellent Staff — But Buffet Dinner Was a Total Letdown

Stayed at Park Hyatt Chennai and while much of the experience was pleasant, there were a few key disappointments.

The staff was superb — warm, welcoming, and highly professional.

Check-in and check-out were smooth and efficient.

Rooms are spacious and comfortable, but could definitely use better lighting, especially in the evenings.

Concierge and front desk took unusually long to respond to calls — phones kept ringing without an answer.

The biggest letdown: buffet dinner was shockingly poor for the price charged. The spread was very limited, especially for a luxury hotel. 0/5 for this — completely not worth the premium rate.

Additionally, they even charged for a 4-year-old child, which felt unreasonable.

Aside from the buffet disappointment, the property is well-maintained, and most services were on point. But for a hotel of this caliber, such a poor dinner spread was unexpected and dampened the experience.

text.text:
good hotel review should be descriptive and informative, painting a clear picture of the experience while also highlighting what makes the hotel unique. It should cover the location, amenities, rooms, service, and overall experience. Reviews should be concise, well-written, and provide details that would be helpful to other travelers.

Here's a more detailed breakdown of what to include in a hotel review:

1. Location and Accessibility:

Note the proximity to attractions, transportation hubs (like train stations or airports), and local amenities.

Mention the ease of getting around from the hotel.

If the hotel offers airport transfers, mention that as well.

2. Rooms and Amenities:

Describe the room's cleanliness, size, and overall comfort.

Mention the quality of the bed and bathroom.

Highlight any unique amenities like a great shower or comfortable bed.

If you have any specific room recommendations, such as staying above the ground floor for better privacy, share that.

3. Service and Staff:

Comment on the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff.

Mention any particularly positive interactions with staff members.

If the hotel offers excellent service, be sure to mention that.

4. Food and Dining:

If the hotel has a restaurant, mention the quality of the food and whether it offers good value for money.

If the hotel offers a breakfast spread, mention the options available.

5. Overall Experience:

Provide an overall assessment of the hotel's value for money.

Mention whether you would recommend the hotel to others and if you would consider staying there again.

If the hotel offers a unique experience, make sure to highlight it.

6. Things to Consider:

Be honest and objective in your review.

Focus on the aspects of your stay that were particularly good or bad.

Provide constructive feedback that can help the hotel improve.

Be concise and to the point, while still being descriptive.

But will i come back, definitely yes - great value for what it offers among it's peers.

text.text:
I was very disappointed with my stay at this hotel. We had a long stay in this hotel and extended multiple times due to medical  reasons. We stayed in 4 different rooms in the third floor the floor/ rooms is infested with cockroaches, we found insects in the teabag and coffee drawer in one of the rooms.the manager was informed several times. They didn’t change the sheets often only when we requested although we had more than a ten day stay. Cleanliness should be the top priority for any property, but unfortunately this was severely lacking. The bedding and sofas had stains. Some of the staff in the kitchen area handled the bread with their own hand although there were tongs.
This hotel is supposed to be 5-star, but it doesn’t even come close to international standards.
Definitely not worth the money, I would not stay here again. The only reason we stayed because it was not easy to move with a patient and the bed mattress was good.

text.text:
We recently stayed at this hotel in Chennai, and our overall experience was quite pleasant with a few highs and lows. The room was simply superb — we originally booked a Superior Room but were pleasantly surprised when the hotel upgraded us to a Junior Suite at no extra cost. This gesture definitely elevated our stay and gave us a great room experience.

The hotel staff were trendy and professional, but unfortunately, we didn’t feel properly welcomed on arrival. The front desk seemed too caught up in their work to give us the warm hospitality you’d expect from a 5-star property.

Despite being located in a busy part of Chennai, stepping into the hotel felt like entering a completely different atmosphere — calm, elegant, and peaceful.

We had opted for both breakfast and dinner buffet. The breakfast buffet was quite good, offering a decent spread. However, the dinner buffet was disappointing — the taste and variety did not live up to a 5-star standard and definitely needs improvement.

A special mention goes to the swimming pool — it was fantastic, very relaxing, and had thoughtful features that made it a highlight of our stay.

To sum it up: the room and overall hotel services were excellent, especially the complimentary upgrade and pool experience. The welcome experience and food quality, particularly dinner, were the downsides. With better attention to hospitality and culinary refinement, this hotel could truly deliver a top-tier experience.

text.text:
I’ve been here for two weeks now and decided to extend my stay for a couple more weeks based on my experience so far. My stay has been pleasant and comfortable, thanks to the staff who work tirelessly to meet guests’ needs with a smile and utmost patience.
The rooms are clean, well-maintained, and serviced daily. The hotel has a welcoming ambience and a vibrant atmosphere with its restaurant, bar, and a well-equipped gym.
The staff across the departments has been professional, courteous, and attentive to detail. The breakfast spread is impressively elaborate, catering to both local and international guests. I suggested adding more protein-rich vegetarian options, and the team promptly incorporated them—a thoughtful gesture I truly appreciated.
A special mention to the restaurant staff for their personalized care and to the guest relations managers for accommodating our requests.
I would definitely recommend this hotel on Chamiers Road to friends visiting from the US

Other than that, nothing was special about this place. The breakfast was mediocre. Could have gone for better options for the price outside the hotel.

text.text:
I had a terrible experience at this hotel. The room was filthy, and worst of all, the bed was infested with bed bugs. My companions and I were bitten multiple times, leaving us with itchy and painful marks. We barely got any sleep because of the discomfort.

The toilet was disgusting, there was black mold on the door and at the bottom of the toilet, making it clear that cleanliness is not a priority at this hotel. It was unhygienic and completely unacceptable.

When we reported the bed bug issue to the hotel staff, despite showing clear evidence of the bites, they completely denied that the bed had bed bugs. Instead of properly addressing the issue, their “solution” was to swap the bed with another from a different room, which is beyond unacceptable!

To make things worse, the manager and receptionist were extremely rude and unhelpful, showing no concern for our situation. The manager dismissed our complaint, saying that in his many years there, they had never experienced bed bugs, yet my entire family was covered in bites! The only saving grace was a kind and understanding female staff, but unfortunately, that did not make up for the horrible experience we had.

Avoid this hotel at all costs unless you want to deal with poor hygiene, bed bugs, dirty toilets, and rude staff.

text.text:
I had a pleasant 8-night stay at this hotel and would definitely consider returning. The front office staff were helpful, and the food was tasty and reasonably priced.

While the housekeeping service was consistent initially, it became slower during the last three days—I had to follow up a couple of times to get my room cleaned. They said the laundry person sent the items late. They did clean my room with a friendly smile.  😃  Thanks to Ms Usha.

I made my booking through Agoda. Although my initial room request wasn’t fulfilled on the first day, I was moved to a room with a bigger bed on the second day. It didn’t have a window view, but it was clean, cozy, and comfortable.

The location is excellent—easily accessible autos, walking distance to Pondy Bazaar and the Om Namo Narayana temple, several good vegetarian restaurants, and even a handy sundry shop nearby.

I had an early morning flight, and the hotel reception kindly arranged a cab for me. He went the extra mile by negotiating the fare with the driver to ensure I got a reasonable and fair price for the ride. As the bell boy was not free, the restaurant waiter help me with my baggages.  Truly appreciate all their assistance.  ❤️

text.text:
I stayed in Green Park hotel in Chennai on July 17th and was assigned a room where I encountered a serious hygiene issue: cockroaches. Despite informing the front desk immediately, the response was minimal. Only one dead cockroach was removed and I was told everything was fine—but sightings continued throughout the day. I’ve documented this with photographs.
I emailed the hotel and attached the photos, expecting a timely response. Unfortunately, I received no reply or acknowledgment. This lack of follow-up only added to the frustration.

As a returning guest, I had expected much better. The casual response to a cleanliness concern was unacceptable, especially after spending a significant amount at the hotel’s in-house restaurant. This experience has deeply affected my trust in the property.

I hope the management takes feedback like this seriously and works to improve both hygiene standards and responsiveness.

text.text:
Our experience at Green Park Vadapalani was very good overall. The customer service was commendable, and the breakfast options were satisfying with a decent variety to choose from. We genuinely enjoyed our stay.

One highlight that truly stood out was the live flute player in the mornings—his music was absolutely beautiful. We made it a point to sit and watch him play every day. It gave us such a happy, peaceful start and really boosted our mood each morning.

The location is also a major plus. There’s a mall right beside the hotel, which made things super convenient, and there are temples and local shops all around, all within walking distance. It was very easy to get around without needing transport all the time.

One thing I do wish they considered, though, is showcasing more of the Indian culture. Many people visit places like this to experience that unique cultural touch, but none of the staff or servers reflected it. It would have been lovely to see them in traditional Indian attire—it would have added so much charm and authenticity, instead of sticking solely to Western norms.

text.text:
I had an adhoc trip to Chennai and needed to be next to the main railway system. This hotel ranked decently in online reviews and hence booked them via phone.

Check-in had some confusion as the guy who confirmed to me had not noted or told the other new guy in reception BUT they resolved and provided the room. The room was decent size with hot water availability.

Service levels can be improved as they have only 1-2 folks as room boys for the entire hotel and morning breakfast should start at least by 7 am vs the 8-8:30 am currently.

All in all, a decent place and right next to platform 1,2 at Chennai Central. They will give you 24/7 check-in check-out facility if booked with them directly.

text.text:
Wow – where do I even begin? This stay was absolutely amazing from start to finish! I honestly didn’t expect to feel this comfortable and pampered on a trip.

The room was spotless. Every day it felt like walking into a freshly made space. The attention to detail in the cleaning was next level.

What truly blew me away was the dress washing and ironing service – so professional, fast, and just incredibly helpful. I didn’t have to worry about a thing!

And the room boys… they were honestly the sweetest and most respectful people I’ve met at any hotel. So polite, so helpful – they made everything feel easy and welcoming.

You can even order food through them, and it’s delivered right to your room – super convenient, especially after a long day.

I felt completely taken care of – not like a guest, but like family. 💛
If I could give more than 5 stars, I would! I can’t wait to come back!

I had a very disappointing experience at this hotel. We paid for 3 people, but the room provided was extremely small and could barely accommodate 2. There was only one queen-size bed, and when we asked for extra bedding, they gave only a single mattress without even a bedsheet. The toilet was broken, and the room was not properly cleaned.

The room service was the worst part — every request took almost an hour, which is unacceptable for any hotel. Overall, the service and facilities were far below basic expectations.

This place is completely misleading and feels like a fraud. Please don’t book this hotel — save your money and avoid the hassle.

text.text:
Me and my partner booked this hotel through the OYO helpline because many affordable hotels don't accept foreigners. On advice and consultation from the helpline she assured us that the booking accepts foreigners. I needed to do some visa work which required my C form and this hotel did not make and refused to make the document which is necessary and by law required. They were video calling friends with me in the background which violated my sense of self.

The actual rooms were super ill equipped. The ac did not work (in fact many people complained about this), the bedsheets were super stained!! Gross. They did not provide towls in the room and the water for the shower wasn't working at first. We switched rooms where the ac and the water was working but the bedsheets were still stained. The staff were like zombies, you asked them to help they just stare blankly at you or are actually actively trying to be more unhelpful and just want you to get out the way.

In the end we demanded a full refund, this they gave  - great. It was definitely cheaper than a complaint for not doing their legal duty of a c form. awful experience

editorialSummary.text: Relaxed quarters in a modern hotel featuring dining, an outdoor pool & a fitness centre.

text.text:
I recently stayed at Four Points by Sheraton, booked under a Superior Twin Bed Room by my clients, and the overall experience was very pleasant. The check-in process was smooth and quick, which is always a relief after a long journey.

The room was quite spacious for a business hotel in this range — easily comfortable for two people. It also had a neat little work area, which made catching up on emails and tasks easy and convenient. The beds and sofas were very comfy, perfect for both relaxing and getting some work done.

What stood out was the buffet spread — a good variety of dishes across cuisines, and everything we tried tasted great. It’s definitely one of the highlights if you enjoy hotel dining.

The location is another big plus. Situated on the OMR and near Taramani, it’s ideal if you have meetings or work around this part of Chennai. The views from the room were lovely too, adding a touch of calm to the business vibe.

All in all, Four Points by Sheraton ticks all the boxes for a comfortable, convenient stay — especially for work-related travel. I’d definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the area for business.

originalText.text:
I recently stayed at Four Points by Sheraton, booked under a Superior Twin Bed Room by my clients, and the overall experience was very pleasant. The check-in process was smooth and quick, which is always a relief after a long journey.

The room was quite spacious for a business hotel in this range — easily comfortable for two people. It also had a neat little work area, which made catching up on emails and tasks easy and convenient. The beds and sofas were very comfy, perfect for both relaxing and getting some work done.

What stood out was the buffet spread — a good variety of dishes across cuisines, and everything we tried tasted great. It’s definitely one of the highlights if you enjoy hotel dining.

The location is another big plus. Situated on the OMR and near Taramani, it’s ideal if you have meetings or work around this part of Chennai. The views from the room were lovely too, adding a touch of calm to the business vibe.

All in all, Four Points by Sheraton ticks all the boxes for a comfortable, convenient stay — especially for work-related travel. I’d definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the area for business.

text.text:
I had a wonderful stay at this hotel during my visit to Chennai. From the moment I arrived, the front desk staff made me feel welcome with their warm hospitality and professionalism. The check-in process was smooth and efficient, which set the tone for the rest of my stay. Ankita was exceptional

The room was clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, with all the amenities I needed thanks to Rahul. The room service was excellent — prompt, courteous, and the food arrived hot and fresh every time.

One of the highlights of my stay was the hotel’s restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious, offering a great variety of local and international dishes, all beautifully presented. The ambiance was lovely, and the staff were attentive without being intrusive. Special thanks to Ankit kumar jha  and debashish bakshi

Overall, this hotel exceeded my expectations. I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Chennai, whether for business or leisure. Looking forward to staying here again!

Breakfast is decent and has almost all varieties. Dosa and filter coffee quality are bad though, that too in Chennai.
They must serve freshly squeezed juice, the ones kept on the counter are watery and stale.
Service and staff both were great and we felt comfortable during our stay.
We stayed at the king bedroom and it was spacious and well designed.
Lounge can be improved much, only one veg and nonveg starter are kept along with a salad, veg sandwich and assorted pastries. They have converted a small recreation area next to the bar as the lounge.
Location is on the main road and it's closer to many eateries.

text.text:
We chose this hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary, hoping for a special and memorable experience. Unfortunately, it turned out to be bit disappointing. Upon arrival, we saw the room was far too small and the bed was nowhere near what one would expect for a superior queen size bed. While we appreciated that the staff did arrange some decorations adviced by wife however the overall size and condition of the room felt misleading and underwhelming.

We booked "Superior Queen Room" for three days. Room felt congested and claustrophobic. AC was too slow we were sweating. The bathroom smell like someone smoked for really long time. Even after room freshener it didn't went. After celebrating our disappointing anniversary in the room. We found difficult to sleep on the small bed.

Eventually we had to upgrade the room on the second day, but even that didn’t improve much. The air conditioning was working way too slow, and cleanliness was clearly not a priority. There were few stains on the sofa, bathroom was not cleaned properly. Bed was king but the sheet was for Queen. It was not tucking properly. Had to call room service to fix the bed everytime.

The food was average, serving similar food almost everyday. One morning I took few fruits but it was rotten it had smell. Although they changed immediately but it was there job to check the quality. The most shocking moment came on our last day when my wife saw a cockroach on a buffet plate – I had to personally inform a staff member to remove it. This could have cost life if the cockroaches are on the buffet plate.

Although a few staff members were polite and tried their best, the overall experience was unacceptable. What should have been a joyful anniversary celebration ended up disappointing. For the amount what my wife paid for the suprise especially for the decoration and room upgrade, the service and quality were nowhere close to the expectations. Sadly, I would not return or recommend this place to anyone.

editorialSummary.text: Functional rooms, some with air-conditioning, in a straightforward budget hotel.

text.text:
I rarely write reviews, but this experience was beyond unacceptable. From the moment I checked in, it was clear this hotel has no regard for cleanliness, service, or basic hospitality.

The room was filthy — stained sheets, a foul odor, and dust covering every surface. The bathroom looked like it hadn’t been cleaned in weeks; mold on the tiles, hair in the drain, and no hot water.

Staff were completely indifferent — rude at check-in and nowhere to be found when needed. I requested a room change, and they flatly refused, offering no explanation or apology.

Noise levels were unbearable all night, with people shouting in the halls and music blasting from nearby rooms. Despite repeated complaints, management did absolutely nothing.

The pictures online are completely misleading — what you see is not what you get. This place feels like a rundown lodge, not a functioning hotel.

I checked out a day early and didn’t get so much as a “sorry.” Do yourself a favor — spend your money anywhere else. This was the worst hotel experience I’ve ever had.

text.text:
#Nightmare Stay – Avoid at All Costs!

I wish I could give this place zero stars. From the moment we arrived, it was a disaster. The check-in process took forever because the staff seemed completely untrained and disorganized. When we finally got to our room, it was filthy—stained sheets, hair in the shower, and a terrible smell of dampness.

To make matters worse, the air conditioning was broken, and despite multiple complaints, no one bothered to fix it. The walls were paper-thin, and we could hear everything from the neighboring rooms, making sleep impossible.

Breakfast was a joke—stale bread, cold coffee, and barely edible food. The worst part? The staff was rude and dismissive, acting like they were doing us a favor by even acknowledging our complaints.

I have stayed in budget hotels before, but this was beyond unacceptable. If you value cleanliness, comfort, and basic hospitality, stay far away from this place.
I had an absolutely terrible experience at Hotel Thaj Residency. From the moment I checked in, everything went downhill. The room was filthy—unclean sheets, dust everywhere, and a bathroom that looked like it hadn’t been cleaned in weeks. To make matters worse, there were bed bugs and mosquitoes, making it impossible to sleep.

The air conditioning barely worked, and despite multiple complaints, the staff did nothing to fix it. Speaking of the staff, they were rude and completely unhelpful. They seemed annoyed by even the simplest requests and acted like they were doing us a favor by letting us stay there.

On top of that, they overcharged me and refused to honor the booking price. Breakfast was another disaster—stale food and cold tea that wasn’t even drinkable.

This place is a complete scam, and I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone. Do yourself a favor and stay far away from Hotel Thaj Residency!
They already have connections with Taxi driver, who pickup you from Nearby any Station. Who first talk to you very sweetly. But when you arrived the hotel,they started showing their original face.

editorialSummary.text: Unassuming hotel offering low-key rooms & suites, as well as free Wi-Fi, breakfast & parking.

text.text:
Hotel is a bit old and a decent 2 star hotel. Have lift. They don't give any major toileteries (some basic shampoo and medimix soap is there). Rooms were clean and spacious for 2 of us. Has wifi, gives 2 water bottle complementary. Ac was very slow in cooling, but worked for the night (takes 30 mins to really feel the cooling).

Breakfast was included, but was very basic (idli and Puti, sambar, chutney, lemon juice and tea). Hot water wasn't there in bathrooms and probably was not needed in Chennai weather.

Location is awesome, is very near to US Consulate (3 mins walking, there is underground  subway crossing to cross the road). Whole US Consulate process took 70 mins (from hotel to hotel) for 8am appointment.

Room has TV, but has some local channels only, didnt use it much. Some furniture and finishing is older VS photos on Google, but nothing major as an issue. Bed sheet had some stains but wasn't really a concern for us.

Would recommend for US visa interview stay.

Cleanliness and maintenance are usually fine, but can be inconsistent at times. Overall, a decent luxury option if location and accessibility are your main priorities.

text.text: Had a great stay at Park Avenue Hotel, Chennai. The location is perfect — very close to the US VAC center, which makes it extremely convenient for visa appointments. Most importantly, the service was outstanding — the staff was courteous, attentive, and very helpful throughout my stay. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Chennai, especially for consular or VAC appointments.

text.text:
Worst Experience Ever! Please read completely before going!

I visited Citrus Café at Lemon Tree, Ramapuram with my fiancée, expecting at least basic professionalism for the money they charge. Instead, it turned out to be the worst dining experience I’ve ever had. A complete waste of time and patience.

I ordered a Greek salad, clearly written in the menu with feta cheese. What arrived after one hour was a bowl of chunky, oversized vegetable pieces drowned in lemon juice, with paneer thrown on top instead of feta. No oregano, no olive oil , basically, it wasn’t a Greek salad at all. The staff never bothered to tell us they didn’t have feta. I had to ask the waitress why there was paneer, only for her to casually say, “We don’t have feta, sir.” No apology, no heads-up, nothing.

The basics are missing here. I asked for grilled peri peri chicken skewers with minimal oil and made it extremely clear that my medical condition doesn’t permit me to eat oily food. What came out of the kitchen was deep fried, not grilled. So their “grilled” skewers are a lie too. The staff just shrugged and said sorry. When I asked for the manager, nobody showed up. The kitchen staff came instead and claimed the manager was “busy”.

I also ordered two lime sodas. They never arrived. After wasting an entire hour waiting for just a salad and a wrongly cooked chicken, I told them I’d pay for the pathetic salad and leave. They refused to even let me pay, acting guilty, but what’s the point? Basic courtesy and competence are missing here.

This place claims to have a decent a la carte menu. The reality is they don’t have half the ingredients, they don’t tell you upfront, and they have zero training to handle basic customer requests.

If you value your time, money, tastebuds, and basic respect, do not step inside Citrus Café at Lemon Tree, Ramapuram. It’s run by incompetent staff, clueless chefs, and a manager who hides when there’s a problem. For a brand like Lemon Tree, this level of service is embarrassing.

Never going back. Strongly NOT recommended.

I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights as a single traveller , there for a conference. My stay was beyond hospitality!! It was so so comfortable. Everything is FIVE STAR !!
1. The ambience: open , clean , welcoming and always smelling so fresh .
2. The rooms are spacious and kept clean with all the necessary items . Special mention to the kit that was put separately for a woman needs !!! So so beautiful and touching.

3 . The food . The breakfast spread includes everything. And always a live counter , always ready staff to get u anything u need . The chutneys were so yummy , it needed a special mention.
Also a special mention of Chef. Thamotharan . He cooked a perfect vegetarian thali, as I requested one . It was so so so delicious, I went in food heaven . I strongly recommend u ask him to make u one .

4. Mr . Prabhakaran and Mr. Mohan were so considerate and accomodating.

Ten stars !! To the hotel . Highly recommend!

The Pride Hotel Chennai is a 4-star luxury hotel located in the heart of the city. It offers a range of well-appointed rooms and suites that are tastefully furnished and equipped with modern amenities like air conditioning, flat-screen TVs, minibars, and free Wi-Fi. The hotel also features a rooftop swimming pool, a fitness center, a spa, and several dining options, including a multi-cuisine restaurant, a 24-hour coffee shop, and a rooftop bar.

According to online reviews, guests have praised the hotel's convenient location, comfortable rooms, and excellent service. Some have also noted that the hotel's rooftop pool and bar offer stunning views of the city. However, some guests have also reported issues with noise and cleanliness in their rooms.

Overall, The Pride Hotel Chennai seems to be a popular choice for travelers seeking a comfortable and convenient stay in the city, with good amenities and service.

highlightedText.text: "The rooms are spacious and the shower is heavenly."

text.text:
Good value for money - (Rs 2000-2500 per night + taxes)

Pros:

The hotel is located at a great place likely a midpoint in T. Nagar. The rooms are spacious and the shower is heavenly. Good quality toiletries and no sound overnight.

Cons:.

They don't act upon their no smoking rule, the corridor sometimes reeks of smoke smell, luckily you won't find it inside room.

The Breakfast is average at best, being in Chennai and that too in T. Nagar, they got basics like Idly Vada and upma wrong. Had to order from outside as the vendor from whom the hotel outsources  is horrible and it starts only at 8 am.

It is terribly understaffed I think. To provide me with 3 eating plates, I finished my whole dinner before they came. The service is slow and lethargic although it is done at the end of the day.

One of the rooms I took was very dirty before but they changed everything once informed and no dental kits are provided.

Can take the hotel for short to medium stay, it is comfortable enough and being in a epicenter, most of the things are easily accessible here.

text.text:
Review for K11 Hotel, T Nagar, Chennai

I recently booked a stay at K11 Hotel in T Nagar, Chennai through Booking.com, and I must say, my experience was extremely disappointing. Upon arrival, we were shocked to find that the room we had booked—a spacious accommodation with two king-size beds, a coffee machine, kettle, and other amenities—was not available. Instead, we were given a cramped room with two queen beds, lacking the facilities we had paid for.

To make matters worse, the room was unclean, with dirty towels and a smelly toilet. The air conditioning was non-functional, which made our stay even more uncomfortable. When we approached the manager about the situation, we were told that the room we had booked had been given to another family. This is simply unacceptable. How can a hotel prioritize other guests over those who have made a reservation in advance?

I am baffled by how this hotel has received a 4.7-star rating. My experience was far from satisfactory, and I question the reliability of Booking.com as a booking platform, as I have never encountered such issues with other sites during my travels.

Traveling with individuals of varying ages, we felt poorly treated and discriminated against. I would highly recommend avoiding online bookings at this hotel. Save yourself the trouble and seek accommodations elsewhere.

I recently stayed at Four Points by Sheraton and had a truly comfortable and pleasant experience. The hotel maintains excellent cleanliness standards, and the staff was courteous, helpful, and very professional throughout our stay.

The room was spacious, well-equipped, and had a modern design with all the expected amenities — including a comfortable bed, fast Wi-Fi, and a clean bathroom. The food at the in-house restaurant was delicious, especially the breakfast buffet which had a wide range of options catering to both Indian and international tastes.

The location is very convenient, with easy access to the airport and major city attractions. Their airport pickup and drop service was punctual and smooth.

Overall, I highly recommend Four Points by Sheraton for both business and leisure travelers looking for a blend of comfort, service, and value.

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

I had a wonderful stay at this hotel during my visit to Chennai. From the moment I arrived, the front desk staff made me feel welcome with their warm hospitality and professionalism. The check-in process was smooth and efficient, which set the tone for the rest of my stay. Ankita was exceptional

The room was clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, with all the amenities I needed thanks to Rahul. The room service was excellent — prompt, courteous, and the food arrived hot and fresh every time.

One of the highlights of my stay was the hotel’s restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious, offering a great variety of local and international dishes, all beautifully presented. The ambiance was lovely, and the staff were attentive without being intrusive. Special thanks to Ankit kumar jha  and debashish bakshi

Overall, this hotel exceeded my expectations. I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Chennai, whether for business or leisure. Looking forward to staying here again!

text.text:
I wanted to provide some feedback regarding my recent stay at Four Points by Sheraton omr Property. I regret to inform you that my experience did not meet the expected standards, and I feel it is important to address these concerns for future improvement.

Firstly, it is essential to clarify that the property does not fully align with the standards typically associated with Four point properties. The accommodation appeared to lack the luxurious amenities and services commonly associated with such establishments.

One of the primary issues I encountered was the limited food options available on-site. Considering the INR 1000 charge( Outskirt area of Chennai), the offerings did not add significant value to the overall experience. It is crucial for guests to have a variety of choices, especially in a property aiming for a 3-4-star rating.

Additionally, the rooms were not as spacious as expected, particularly the restroom facilities. The lack of space, especially for individuals who are not of a slim build, made the experience uncomfortable and inconvenient.

Moreover, the location of the property was less than desirable, situated on the outskirts of the city. This contributed to a sense of isolation and inconvenience, further detracting from the overall experience. The poor location, coupled with subpar service and food quality, failed to meet the expectations associated with a 3-4-star property.

In conclusion, I believe it is imperative to address these concerns promptly to enhance the overall guest experience. Improving the variety and quality of food options, ensuring spacious and comfortable accommodations, and considering the property's location are key areas that require attention.

Thank you for considering my feedback. I hope these points will assist in enhancing the quality of service and accommodations provided.

text.text:
Title: A Luxurious Retreat at IBIS OMR : A Review of Excellence

Nestled along the pristine shores of Chennai OMR  the IBIS OMR,, stands as a beacon of luxury and tranquility. My recent stay at this exquisite establishment left me in awe of its impeccable service, stunning surroundings, and unparalleled hospitality. From the moment I stepped foot into the lobby to the day of my departure, every aspect of my experience at IBIS OMR exceeded my expectations.

Upon arrival, I was warmly greeted by the friendly staff, but one individual truly stood out – Anchu, the epitome of hospitality. Anchu's genuine smile and impeccable professionalism immediately made me feel welcome and valued as a guest. Throughout my stay, she went above and beyond to ensure that every detail of my visit was taken care of, from arranging restaurant reservations to providing insightful recommendations for local attractions. Her dedication to excellence truly enhanced my stay and left a lasting impression.

The accommodation at IBIS OMR surpassed all expectations. My room,was with  elegantly appointed with modern amenities and luxurious furnishings. The attention to detail was evident in every aspect of the room, from the plush bedding to the tasteful decor. Each morning, I awoke to the gentle sound of waves lapping against the shore, a serene backdrop for the perfect start to the day.

One of the highlights of my stay was the culinary experience at Paradise Cove. The resort boasts a diverse array of dining options, each offering delectable cuisine crafted with the finest ingredients. From fresh seafood at the beachfront grill to gourmet international dishes at the fine dining restaurant, every meal was a culinary delight. Special mention must be made of Chef Miguel, whose culinary expertise shone through in every dish. His passion for food was evident in the exquisite flavors and presentation, leaving me eager to return for another gastronomic adventure.

Beyond the exceptional amenities and dining options, IBIS OMR offers an array of activities to suit every interest. there is no shortage of ways to unwind and embrace the beauty of paradise. The attentive staff at the resort's concierge desk, led by the efficient and knowledgeable Maria Martinez, were instrumental in arranging my activities and ensuring a seamless experience.

In addition to its luxurious amenities and breathtaking surroundings, what truly sets IBIS OMR apart is its unparalleled commitment to guest satisfaction. Every staff member I encountered during my stay, from the housekeeping team to the groundskeepers, exuded warmth and professionalism, creating a welcoming atmosphere that felt like home away from home. The genuine care and attention to detail demonstrated by each member of the IBIS OMR team truly set a new standard for hospitality excellence.

As I reluctantly bid farewell to IBIS OMR, I left with cherished memories and a profound appreciation for the exceptional experience provided by this remarkable resort. From the breathtaking natural beauty of its surroundings to the impeccable service and warm hospitality of its staff, Paradise Cove exceeded all expectations and left an indelible mark on my heart. My heartfelt thanks to Sarah Johnson and the entire team at Paradise Cove for an unforgettable stay. I eagerly anticipate my return to this slice of paradise in the near future.

highlightedText.text: "We booked a suite room and it was extremely spacious and well-maintained."

text.text:
The facilities were nice. We booked a suite room and it was extremely spacious and well-maintained.
The upsetting part about this hotel is their service staff. Extremely lazy, there is no sense of service. All they did was talk and talk to each other and neglect the customers. We'd been to the restaurant for dinner. We placed an order for 3 drinks, waited for what seemed forever, and got only 2 drinks. Again, I placed an order for another drink, waited for eternity, and then got the drink. The service team in the restaurant lacks detail to attention.
Same with the breakfast. We ordered a dosa at the live breakfast counter. The chef quickly prepared it and placed it on the plate. The service person was too busy talking to his colleague to bring the dosa, so I walked up to the counter to take the dosa. The chef immediately realized this and called out for the service staff and told him to take the dosa.

These might seem like small incidents, but courtesy and a great experience are what customers are looking for. That's what sets an average hotel and a great hotel apart.
This is a good hotel with below average service.

text.text:
Location:
LemonTree in Mount Poonamalle, Chennai, is a hidden gem that offers the perfect blend of tranquility and accessibility. Nestled away from the hustle and bustle of the city, this hotel is conveniently located for both leisure and business travelers. Situated just a short drive from the Chennai International Airport and key attractions like the Sriperumbudur Industrial Park, the hotel's location is a definite plus. The serene surroundings and lush greenery make it an ideal place to unwind after a busy day. The beautiful views of the surrounding landscape add to the overall charm of LemonTree, making it an excellent choice for those seeking a peaceful retreat.

Service:
The service at LemonTree, Mount Poonamalle, is truly exceptional. From the moment you step into the hotel, you are greeted with warm smiles and a sense of genuine hospitality. The staff is courteous, attentive, and always ready to assist with any request. Whether it's arranging transportation, providing local recommendations, or attending to special dietary preferences, the staff goes above and beyond to ensure that guests have a comfortable and enjoyable stay. Their professionalism and dedication to guest satisfaction are truly commendable and contribute significantly to the overall experience.

Food:
One of the standout features of LemonTree, Mount Poonamalle, is its culinary offerings. The hotel's restaurant serves a delectable array of dishes that cater to diverse tastes. Whether you're in the mood for traditional South Indian cuisine or international fare, there's something for everyone. The breakfast buffet is particularly impressive, featuring a wide selection of dishes, including freshly prepared dosas, idlis, and an assortment of continental breakfast items. The quality of the food is excellent, and the presentation is top-notch. Moreover, the restaurant staff is attentive and ensures that your dining experience is nothing short of delightful.

In conclusion, LemonTree, Mount Poonamalle, Chennai, is a fantastic choice for travelers looking for a peaceful retreat with easy access to key locations in the city. The hotel's exceptional service and delectable cuisine add to its appeal, making it a memorable destination for both business and leisure travelers. Whether you're seeking relaxation or a convenient base for your Chennai adventures, LemonTree delivers on all fronts, making it a top recommendation for your next visit to the area.

highlightedText.text: "The rooms are spacious, well furnished, clean, The bathroom is really nice."

text.text:
We stayed there for 1 night only.
Loved everything.
Located only 30 mins far from Chennai Airport, exactly opposite of Miot Hospital.

The rooms are spacious, well furnished, clean, The bathroom is really nice.
Every little things are taken cared for.
They have free wifi, running hot water, AC and all the usual necessities.
However i really loved the the consumables they provided, like small disposable shaving tools, toilet kits, various selection of tea/coffee etc to make in the morning...

They also have a well functioning Restaurant service at the ground floor, named Citrus.
Food can be taken at the restaurant, and room service is also available.
